noun.description: A native or inhabitant of Neustria, the western part of the Frankish empire (lying roughly west of the Meuse and north of the Loire rivers) in the Merovingian period.

adjective.description: Of or relating to Neustria or its inhabitants.

origin: Mid 17th century. From post-classical Latin Neustria, the name of a territory in the western part of the medieval Frankish Empire.
